import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)

# Input data files are available in the read-only "../input/" directory
# For example, running this (by clicking run or pressing Shift+Enter) will list all files under the input directory

import os
for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'):
    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

source.84943850: If a data scientist is enrolled in a full-time program, he's more likely to start looking for a new job. Whereas if he is not enrolled in any university program, he's more likely to stay.
source.9ef7269d: Early stage startups and public sector companies have proportionally more data scientists looking for new jobs.
source.8b98d765: More than 50% of the data scientist are working in cities with development score more than 0.9.
source.a1dea9a9: 90% of data scientists are male! Only 8% of them are female.
source.19c490d7: 62% of data scientists only have a graduate degree while only 23% of them have masters degree. Only 2% of them have PhDs!
source.ac125021: Graduates are more likely to start looking for better jobs compared to data scientists who have masters degree.
